definition: to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: It echoes complex sentence with conjunction in grammar.
sentences.chinese: 它處於與連接詞複合句相對立的語法位置。

sentences.english: The arranging of clauses one after the other without connectives showing the relation between.
sentences.chinese: 小句之間的關係不靠連接詞來維繫。

sentences.english: As function words, English connectives have been ignored by academic circle.
sentences.chinese: 英語連接詞作爲虛詞，一直爲學術界所忽視。

sentences.english: To introduce various conjunctions and the use of them.
sentences.chinese: 介紹連接詞的使用方式。

definition: language component/morpheme/individual characters (making up an expression)
part of speech (noun, verb, adjective etc)/lexical category
(idiom) to have one's words turn out to be (tragically) prophetic
